titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jacob Ranft title abstract 1978.007
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-19 21:40:59 +0000.

did.abstract: An 1843-1907 title abstract for a piece of property purchased by Jacob Ranft and his wife, Margaret, in Queens, New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single multi-page document housed in a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jacob Ranft title abstract, 1978.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A title abstract for a piece of property purchased by Jacob Ranft and his wife, Margaret, and located on the Southern side of Norman and Cypress Streets in Queens, New York. Dates found within the abstract range from 1843 to 1907. This property was originally part of a land tract owned by Nicholas N. Wycoff. The title gives a description of how the land was originally partioned after Wycoff's death on July 2, 1843. The property was bought by the Ranft Family in 1907.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
